goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog

Class GOALPrologProg

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.GOALProg<swiprolog3.language.PrologTerm,PrologAtom,swiprolog3.language.PrologUpdate>
      • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.GOALPrologProg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Automaton, Program

    public class GOALPrologProg
extends GOALProg<swiprolog3.language.PrologTerm,PrologAtom,swiprolog3.language.PrologUpdate>
    Represents a program component for a single-agent GOAL system in the absence of an environment that is based on the Prolog KRT.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GOALPrologProg(java.lang.String path, Formula negphi, Controller cont, boolean por)
      Constructs a GOALPrologProg object according to the agent file at the specified path, given the formula under investigation, the controller that invokes this constructor, and a flag indicating whether partial order reduction should be applied.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GOALPrologProg

        public GOALPrologProg(java.lang.String path,
              Formula negphi,
              Controller cont,
              boolean por)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructs a GOALPrologProg object according to the agent file at the specified path, given the formula under investigation, the controller that invokes this constructor, and a flag indicating whether partial order reduction should be applied.
        Parameters:
        path - - The path at which the agent file should be found.
        f - - The formula under investigation.
        cont - - The controller that controls the object to be created.
        por - - Flag indicating whether POR should be applied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMemoryConsumption

        public long getMemoryConsumption()
        Description copied from interface: Program
        Gets the current memory consumption of computation of the program that is not Java-related, i.e. does not involve the Java heap. For instance, if Prolog is in any way during successor generation, this method should return Prolog's memory demands.
        Returns:
        The memory consumption.

      • getPLStats

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> getPLStats()
        Requests Prolog statistics, and returns those as a HashMap. The returned statistics are the number of inferences, atoms, functors, predicates, modules, and used heap.
        Returns:
        The statistics.

      • printPLStatistics

        public void printPLStatistics()
        Prints Prolog statistics to console. The printed statistics are the number of inferences, atoms, functors, predicates, modules and used heap.
